Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Burnett6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the City Hotel for three nights at the beginning of march. Hotel was lovely, the rooms were spacious, clean and nicely decorated, very italian looking just as you see on the website. There were plenty of hangers for clothes and the hotel came with all the little toiletries and a hair dryer. The only thing we didnt like was that there wasnt a safety deposit box to rent, you could pay 5 euros at the front desk, but it is only an envolope being put in a drawer. so i would recommend getting a travel money card before you go or taking a little lock and key for your suitcase just for peace of mind.Having said that the hotel is very safe and secure anyway and the staff are lovely. the location was perfect, a 2 min walk to the spanish steps, and 5 min walk to the trevi fountain, and theres a metro station at both so its really easy to get about. theres a lovely little restaurant we ate at twice which is opposite the american express bank near the spanish steps in the little square, the food there was the best we have ever tasted. When you get to the airport and you are at train station to take you to termini station there is a ticket station just as you walk in, we asked for train tickets there and he said for 15 euros each he will drive us to our hotel which worked out very well as its the same price as the train, and termini station is absolutely huge when we was returning we got the train and it was as if we were at a airport. Also make sure you have breakfast at the hotel, we found it very hard to find any restaurants that did breakfast, but the hotel has a nice selection of cakes and cereal. I am a travel agent myself and i will be recommending this hotel to all my customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nearingretirement
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, friendly, clean and set in a great location. our room was small and basic, very clean with a recently fitted new bathroom. The room was one of the higher floor rooms and subsequently let a good deal of daylight into the room, at street level the area remains mainly in the shade due to tall buildings and narrow streets, so a room on a higher level was a bonus. (The hotel is situated 2 floors above street level anyway). Breakfast again was basic continental style but totally satisfactory with everything being fresh and tasty. Location is brilliant, 5 mins Spanish Steps, 5 mins Trevi Fountain, 5 mins Hop on Hop off buses. Several companies to choose from. Most of the major sites are within walking distance if you are reasonably mobile. Excellent choice of Restaurants all within short distance of hotel. We felt we made a good choice for a short city break to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Daniel J
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the location and it did not disappoint. Great, very great location, friendly staff, right price and good breakfast. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Nice stay. I definitely recommend it. Rome is a wonderful dream. This hotel served its purpose as a clean place to sleep with in a great location. I have never been to Rome before and I was able to navigate the city fine from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Bridgnorthmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid February. My husband and teenage son in one room my elderly disabled mother and I in another. The lift referred to in other reviews was no problem for us and very quaint. Rooms are spotlessly clean. It's a bit " shabby chic " in places but the staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is basic but good quality. Croissants , little cakes , brioche and yoghurts and cereals ... Coffee served in little jugs was delicious and a nice way to start the day. Spanish steps is a two minute walk in one direction. Trevi fountain 5 mins the other way. Designer shops abound.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireSmoggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011 for 4 days of our honeymoon, the hotel itself is very clean and has friendly staff who are only too happy to help you with directions etc. The rooms are nice with very high ceilings and are kept clean everyday while you explore the many sights of Rome. Breakfast is defiantly continental with plenty of bread and cakes which does take a little getting use to as there is no option to have toast or cereal etc. The location of this hotel is perfect as it is a stones throw away from the Spanish steps, the Trevi fountain and the excellent shopping. My best experience personally was visiting the Vatican (worth taking a guided tour as very interesting and the sistene chapel was amazing) my husband really enjoyed the colesseum but be aware of the people outside who charge you 20 euros to take photos using your own camera. You also get plagued by men trying to sell you roses and cotton handmade bracelets for 10 euros each! We personally found Rome to be very expensive for everything but all in all we still enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired and depressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: 765loobyloo
Reviews.Content: We checked straight out on arrival. They must have spent a fortune photoshopping the pictures of the rooms for their web site as they are nothing like is in reality. We thought something was not right on arrival with a grubby unwelcoming entrance that didn't even appear to be a hotel. Dusty dried pampas grass hangs limply from pots in hall, old fashioned interior and views over a dank back of a building. Loo not working and voices easily heard from next room is not what you expect for £185 per night. This is more like a 2 star £50 a night hotel. Only good thing was the receptionist and the central location. We found wonderful hotel for £140, hotel Metropolis, near metro and easy bus route.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lovleylauren
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just off one of the main streets and was the perfect location for sightseeing. Turning left out of the hotel and down a couple of side streets takes you to the Trevi fountain. Left out of the hotel roughly the same distance are the Spanish steps. On arrival we found the hotel to be up 2 flights of stairs with the option of a nice wooden lift up the centre. The reception was through two modern glass doors into a classically decorated entrance hall with wood desk. The staff were always friendly and promptly passed on faxed messaged with information about booked excursions and flight transfers. The desk was always manned and the attached lounged comfortably lit and clean. Our room was spacious with high ceilings and wooden floors to keep the whole place cool. There were extra blankets and pillow in the walk in wardrobe and an information guide on the writing desk. the bathroom was clean and spacious also, the water was a bit loud but this was obviously a very old historical building. Finally although it was the middle of July the temperature inside the hotel was always comfortable and the shutters on the windows allowed a good nights sleep even in the middle of a busy tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cassieb78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as the first leg of our Italian adventure, moving to Venice and Lake Garda afterwards. The location was great, very close to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The place itself was rather unusual to us - on the second floor in an old building, with a very tiny and old lift to get to it. The entrance to the building itself was not the smartest, but the hotel was rather quaint and in some ways rather lovely. It was clean and the staff were friendly. The room was a little small, but the bathroom was very nice. Breakfast was ok, but nothing to rave about. We were glad that this was the first hotel on our trip and not after the 2nd and 3rd as it would have been a bit of a let down after these I think. But as a base for a sightseeing trip we thought it was pretty good and I loved the character of the place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Citybreak!”
Reviews.Author: Tenchistrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the City hotel for 3 nights end of July and have no complaints. The location was fabulous and the staff friendly and attentive. The facilities were spotlessly clean and breakfast was lovely. We got a special 3 nights for the price of 2 deal through citalia which is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - close to everything”
Reviews.Author: lnnj861
Reviews.Content: Booked through Bookings and got a great rate. Read the TA reviews. We didn't come to Rome to watch TV so the TV channels were fine. Hotel was very clean - very friendly staff that was very helpful with directions, reservations and suggestions. Nice breakfast and coffee in the morning. More than enough to get your day started before you left the hotel. We wanted a place that let us walk and thsi was close to everything. We could open the windows and shutters .Very enjoyable and I would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EW1431
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (10 and 8). The family room was essentially a smallish room with a double bed on a mezzanine level above. I saw another family room similarly designed. We had no view whatsoever. But, it is in a great location, is quiet, the staff are charming, and the rooms were spotlessly clean. The breakfast is simple but good, and the cappucino was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Carolina1961_11
Reviews.Content: I think it should be a 2 stars is in a second floor of an ancient building the lobby was depressing, the room was average but no fridge, the breakfast was lousy, there were nobody to help with the luggage has to take two different elevators. The only good thing was the location very close to spanish steps and Fontana di Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION -LOW VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: DIMOSPAG
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit to Rome and have liked to stay in the same area as our last time ,near the Antic Rome near to Spanish Steers even though we know that it will cost us more than any other area in Rome. City hotel is 3* star hotel but after our opinion it is not more than 2*.The value for money very low.First of all, I have sent one e mail to their e mail address, inform them when we will arrive .We never took any answer back. Upon our arrival an impolite receptionist welcome us.Then my wife had inform him that she has fear for use the hotel lift ,he told her that there was not any other way to go up stairs. Of course it was, by our support using the fair escape exist .That it was not able for him to her know…..It is on the web site that there is an internet connection all over the hotel. It was not. We have the family room 201 and it was able either in the or in the corridor .I have to work in the reception. The breakfast it was very poor ,no eggs no normal cheese not fruit .On other older receptionist had bad the things better for us .The staff in the breakfast room and the cleaning staff very good.I would not recommend this hotel to any other …….

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, clean, central and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Duffton
Reviews.Content: It comes up in the Trevi area but this hotel is actually just off the Piazza Espagna. I'd asked for a twin room and they gave us a double, but they made them up as a twin for the next day. They also after some prompting booked us a table at a local restaurant (Al Moro, sooo good). The room was small but high ceilinged, the bathroom clean and functional - all in all a pretty good three star hotel, reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: skinnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. The hotel is ideally situated just a 5 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The room was very small and the air conditioning broke down on the last night - the temp was over 30! The room was very clean, the staff were very helpful. Breakfast was basic but adequate but there are no other facilities. Ideal as a base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvr2010-06
Reviews.Content: The City Hotel is located in a great area if you love to shop!! The subway is also within minutes to the hotel. The Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain are a very quick walk away. The rooms were very spacious considering we had 3 beds in our room. The first night didn't start off very nicely as it poured rain which caused a sewer like smell in our bathroom. I went to the Front Desk to see if we could move rooms but they were fully booked so we were stuck for the first night. The smell did go away and the housekeeping staff placed an air freshener in our bathroom. That seemed to help a lot as we did not have a repeat in the smell. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast included in our room rate was wonderful. A lot of great cold breakfast items to choose from and the staff in the breakfast room was always very attentive and efficient. The breakfast served was a great way to start our busy days in Rome. Overall our stay was pleasant. Not sure if we stay here again but at the same time I would recommend it to those who would like to be close to the shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, room typical size of a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel1020110
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect location if you are on a city break in Rome. You walk out of the hotel door and within 3 mins you are at the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps. The staff were fantastic. Really nice and helpful. The room is small but fine as on a city break you are only in the hotel to change clothes and sleep. It was spotless clean and comfortable. Breakfast was continential and the lady running it is very efficient. On a weekend you may need to wait for a table coming to the end of the breakfast time. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, friendly, clean, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: verity13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband on the first leg of our honeymoon. the hotel is, if a little basic, in a great location for all the sightseeing a tourist would want. We found it a great base for our busy days, with friendly, helpful staff, and clean amenities. Recommended for anyone who wants a base for their adventures in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel.Powell
Reviews.Content: the hotel was clean, simple and the location fantastic. staff really nice, the rooms are small but all you need. we were at the front hotel on a high floor so not too noisy. great coffee to start the day off we will stay here again on our next trip to rome. ask where to eat and they will send you to a fantastic restaurant just around the corner with pizza to die for and full of locals not just tourists and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location if you like designer shops! Hotel not that great”
Reviews.Author: LizandMarkLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in March 2009. Hotel is located a few minutes from the Spanish Steps and 5 mins from the Trevi fountain. All the designer shops are only a few roads away. The hotel room was small and the bed was the hardest I had ever slept on - extremely uncomfortable. The shower ran hot and cold, there was no bath plug, no TV reception, no tea making facilities, no air conditioning or heating (this is only turned on in the summer months). Some of the reception staff were very nice and helpfull EXCEPT one grumpy, unfriendly man who worked the night shift (from about 4pm onwards). I would recommend asking all your questions on where to go in the evening to the day staff when you go out in the morning. Lots of nice but expensive restaurants around the hotel and a McDonalds (good for cheap tea and coffee) on the same street, 1 min walk away. Breakfast was included in our price but was very basic and I wouldnt have paid much for it. Metro station is a 5 min walk away and all tour buses leave from there. We did a bus tour but thought it was the worst one we had done in any country before. Tip - go to Cripta dei Cappuccini - a strange site round the corner near the metro and not very touristy but unusual and worth a look; and visit the church of Saint ignazio da loyola which has a magnificant fake dome. In all, its OK if you get a really cheap deal and really want to stay near the shops but we wouldnt recommend it to anyone, especially with the really hard beds!

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel without the frills but with all the service”
Reviews.Author: daffodillydally
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a long weekend in Rome staying at the City Hotel. The staff were always helpful and polite, the rooms were clean and comfortable with linen and towels changed daily, and the location was very central. We stayed in rooms at the front of the hotel and were not bothered by outside noise despite having the windows open. The continental breakfast offered by this small hotel was varied, with fresh bread and pastries purchased daily as there is no hotel kitchen. However, if you chose a later breakfast you may find that these have run out by the time you get there. They also do not provide a take-away breakfast if you are going on any excursions where you have to leave before breakfast starts. There is also a very small lift up to the second floor which only takes two people at a time but which adds to the character of the hotel. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT lOCATION”
Reviews.Author: _Dave_073
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent 4 day break here , great location we walked to all the major attractions , had a problem with the plumbing and were quickly moved to another room, all in all helpful staff clean and tidy. dont know who lived at the back of hotel but there was aconstant police guard outside .

Reviews.Title: “Central location and considerable charm”
Reviews.Author: Mineworker
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel extremely well located for most of central Rome. The hotel is sited on the second floor, with interesting interpretation panels on the ground floor explaining its history. The lift from the ground floor to the hotel was built in the early years of the last century and is a gem - you certainly couldn't find a lift like this in any British hotel. It's great fun, but I wouldn't let a small child use it on his / her own. Exit the hotel and turn right for a five minute walk to the Spanish Steps. Right next to the Steps is the Keats Shelley Memorial House. I found this by accident: I wasn't looking for it. It's dedicated to the life of the Romantic poet John Keats, who died there of tuberculosis within three or four months of arriving in Rome for his health. It's small, inexpensive to visit, and a good way to spend a couple of hours. The Vatican, the Pantheon, the Trevi fountain, the Colliseum - all these are no more than a 30 minute walk from the hotel. We travelled everywhere on foot and found it easy to reach all the historic sites. Restaurants are plentiful, but expensive. There are a few Irish bars in the city centre serving reasonably priced beer ( about £9 a pint elsewhere ) and hearty food. We liked the Trinity College bar - comfortable and a homely welcome from the staff. Back to the hotel. Rooms are adequate and are in keeping with the character of the hotel. Breakfast is fine as long as you enjoy bread, cake, preserves and pate. The coffee is great and there is a selection of teas - but there isn't really anywhere to sit and enjoy a drink at the end of the day. There's a police landrover on permanent location just outside the hotel. The city centre is certainly well - policed and we felt safe out and about by day and evening. This hotel is well worth a try, particularly if you are prepared to accept that its charm partly lies in that it doesn't try to emulate the minimalist feel of many modern hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap at half the price”
Reviews.Author: Bicholisto
Reviews.Content: Characterful, old-style 3* Italian urban hotel with simple, clean, A/C rooms, marble bathrooms, well-mannered staff, an excellent location (near Trevi Fountain) and reached by an ancient wooden lift which would be illegal in Spain. Rooms at the front are for me impossibly noisy with traffic (especially as the window didn´t close fully): I couldn´t sleep so we changed next day to a back room which was smaller but blissfully quiet and with sunny balcony. We paid 162 euros b&b/night which is obviously overpriced, as is probably the case for all central Rome hotels. Some advice: buy snacks and drinks in the nearby Spar (Via Pozzetto), bring comfortable shoes and walk everywhere (avoid public transport), hide valuables in inside money belts/secret pockets and then relax (the streets felt safe although slightly less so around the Spanish Steps and Piazza Popolo), seek out simple trattorias/pizzerias like Navona Notte (V del Teatro Pace 44, W of Piazza Navona: good pizzas and straccetti), avoid buying beer in bars except the splendid real beers in the inelegantly named Bir & Fud and Che Siete Venuti a Fa which are 2 bars (same owner) in Via Benedetta (cross Ponte Sisto bear a bit left then turn right: try the lunch salads too), use Bernini´s splendid central fountain in Piazza Navona as your guiding central point (NW to Ponte Sant Angelo/Vatican, S to Ponte Sisto/Trastevere, E to Pantheon/Trevi then S to Old Rome). With a bit of research on the web there is plenty to enjoy without suffering the queues and congestion of the "must do" sights.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: sp_gala
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Spanish Steps therefore is very well located. A no frills hotel - you won't get anything more or anything less for a 3 star. The staff was friendly. My room was not large but clean but facing the main street so unfortunately noisy. The TV reception was not all that great. The bathroom and shower were clean and in order. I saw an ashtray in the room so apparently you could smoke in there. The smell was minimal so it was not bothersome. The breakfast was satisfactory - a few sweets, yogurt, various juices, cereals and coffee. All in all, the hotel was OK and more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel (Hotel City - Rome)”
Reviews.Author: parentswithkids
Reviews.Content: The Hotel City in Via Due Macelli (not the city hotel) The Hotel City is a 3 star hotel which is 2 minutes from the Spanish steps and 5 minnutes from the Trevi Fountain. The room we (The wife & I) had was small but very clean, the staff very friendly. We were a little perturbed (very briefly) when on arriving at the hotel in the dark that the local police were standing outside holding what looked like a machine rifle, however it made us feel more secure. Once it was explained that they are always there we didnt give it another thought, in fact they were extremely polite and acknowledged us both morning and evening - giving us directions to the attractions which are right on the door step. In fact we noticed that the Caribinerri were present on almost every street and square we visited. We have never been to Rome before so this made us feel very safe all over the City. We booked through Citalia and found them to be very good, answering any question we posed. We decided not to go for the pre arranged transfer from Campino airport, that would have cost 85 Euro if selected, instead we decided to arrange ourselves. On arrival at the small airport we bought tickets from Terravision, a coach company that transfers you from the airport to the train terminal in Rome centre, for 8 Euros each or 13 return (you can use a another local bus service for 1 euro) as it was dark & had no real Idea where the hotel was we got a taxi from the terminal to the Hotel which cost us 20 Euro, we didnt use any other form of transport other than our feet until we used the Terravision coach back to the Airport. From this hotel we walked to the Colleseum, the Pantheon, Vatican City, Trevi fountain, Campo De Fiori and much more, thinking that if we used buses or trams we would miss so many little squares, passages, streets and most of all the atmosphere. There are plenty of places to eat (as the hotel does not serve meals- other than the continental breakfast) and most are the same sort of prices, however DO NOT drink beer in Italy. Find the SPAR (deSPAR) yes the supermarket, situated by the railway station Via Marsala, by the Hotel City in Via Poll (just off the Largo Chigi on the way to the Trevi Fountain) and on the corner of Via Argo Ginassi & Corso Vittorio Emanuele. Here you can get 1.5l of wine for 2 Euro's & 33cl cans of beer for 0.60euro, take them back to your hotel as we did. On our first night we had a Pizza for 8 Euro each but then had 4 pints of beer at 8 Euors each (total 48 Euros). The best experience was Zio Ciro o or Zi Cir (situated in Via di Propaganda (the next street from the hotel) where we had 2 fantastic freshly perpared spagetti dihes a litre of wine sweets and coffee for lest then 35 Euros - Great friendly, knowledgable cant do enough for you service, obviously proud of the food, well done and thanks. There aren't may public toilets around Rome, but the ones we found Spanish Steps, Colosseum, were nice and clean (despite some Rome reviews stating how bad the toilets in Rome were) and there is always Macdonalds - UGH! These were the worst we visited in the City - the MD's by the Pantheon - disgusting, the MD's by Plazza De La Repubblica was locked with message to obtain key from the Manager - if you can find him/her and then argue the toss obut not buying a sugar/salt filled burgar. Vatican Museum 14 euros each well worth it, but try although its difficult, not to get pushed along by the crowds. Monday is very busy so we decided on Friday and queued for 10 mins from 10.15 am after wailking from Hotel along the Via Cola di Rienzo, which took about an hour (no toilets until the Basilica mind) at a gentle pace. There are security checks such a Xray machines in the Museum and the Basilica which does delay your entry but hey! Enjoy. Must visit the Campo de Fiori, the market, fresh fruit & veg, see how we should do it, 90% of the stuff was home grown. If visiting on an empty stomach be carefeful as the restaraunti/cafes do tend to be over priced we found, and one in Piazza Farnese was extremely expensive & wouldnt serve drinks only. We noticed a few beggars 1 or 2 looked genuine, however when you see one chap in an eye patch praying and begging on the floor one minute and then on a decent mobile phone the next you tend to be a little doubtful as to their integrity. The guys selling flowers particularly around the Spanish Steps are a pain, particularly when eating - they offer a rose stem as a gift but then request a donation - they tend to be the same guys so they eventually get the message. Sellers also include the Asian looking guys selling bracelets, necklaces, sunglasses etc and the African guys (outside the Vatican) selling Dolce, Channel, & Dior handbags. Anyway to some Rome up - excellent, perfect location for the Hotel, dont drive (unless you are unstable) food & drink expensive (beer in particular) safe, beautiful and well worth another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Price not even close to what is stated here”
Reviews.Author: Malyshka
Reviews.Content: I contacted the property directly through their website. The first time I received no response at all. I emailed them again after a week or so, and this time I received a response. Their stated price is not even close to what is shown on trip advisor. 200Euros a night for a double. Given the fact that it is almost impossible to find any information on this hotel, their lack of response, and false presentation of price makes me give this hotel 2 thumbs down. For those of you wanting to give this a try, their website is: [-]

Reviews.Title: “Great location but take ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: Olicana
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Spagna metro (turn right out of the station, walk past the Spanish steps, past the statue and you're nearly there). It's very handy for travelling around the city, and you can walk most of it if you so wish, or use the metro to get around. If you are bringing a car in to Rome the hotel is located in a residents only driving area, the closest place to park is Villa Borghese as it's attached via a walkway to the metro station Spagna. We were in Room 207 which looks out on to the road, thankfully we were exhausted most evenings and slept through, but if you are a light sleeper the noise will bother you. The water pressure in the shower isn't great but the bath is great. Breakfasts were good, enough to keep us going and the coffee is lovely. Staff are very friendly, and room was clean. The only real fault is the noise, but we didn't try and change our room so I guess the fault is our own.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: katehSheffield
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 3 night stay in Rome and a great little hotel. After using Tripadvisor to help us choose we went for City Hotel, on Via due Macelli. The room was SO clean and a good size. Staff were friendly and breakfast was good - its continential, but eat as many croissants as you like! On approach it doesn't look much, but as soon as you get in the little lift you know there is a hidden gem on the second floor! The location couldn't be better - its close to absolutly everything! The longest walk is to the Colisseum, but we took the metro - the station is very close and cheap. We had a room at the front, which can be noisy (traffic noise from the narrow street can only go up!) so if you need quiet to sleep then ask for a room at the back. (But you'll probably be so tired you'll sleep anywhere). Rome is very expensive, which makes this reasonably priced hotel even better value. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the City Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: michelle09
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation, we finally plumped for the City Hotel for a recent four night stay in Rome, and we were very pleased with our choice. The location is great, situated within easy walking distance of the Spanish steps, the Trevi fountain and other sites of interest, as well as transport links. The hotel is nicely decorated, with antique furniture and a very quaint walnut lift: a refreshing change from the big chain hotels. The room was very comfortable with everything you'd need and the bathroom looked like it had been recently refurbished, although it was a little on the small side. I'm not saying that I would necessarily wish to spend all day in the room, but it is perfect as a base for your Roman holiday. There was a continental breakfast included and consisted of cereals/rolls/cheese/yoghurts etc: ample to set you up for a busy day sightseeing. We would certainly stay at the City again and we would recommend it to friends who were planning on visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I Wasnt expecting much....wasnt i wrong”
Reviews.Author: HOLDAYSGALORE
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at this hotel in march. It is so conveniant to walk to anywhere, Just up the road from the spanish steps, resturants. Main shops, you can walk to all the sites, trevi fountain, Colleseum (about 15 mionutes walk but a pleasent one at that). The hotel itself was stunning, we had a lovely little room and the hotel staff were brilliant, very helpful and very polite. I would also reccomend the tours just ask the receptionist they are very good. Thoroughly enjoyed and would highly reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrianPingstone
Reviews.Content: Three things matter to us in a holiday hotel - a clean, bright room, friendly staff and peace. My wife and I got all three here. The room was neat, medium sized ( with a lovely marble bathroom) and at the back (we had 209) so we could not hear any traffic noise whatsoever, just the gentle sound of the air conditioning. The three different male receptionists we met were very friendly and all spoke reasonable English (I speak no Italian). When we had a question about where a jewellers was the receptionist went to Google on his monitor and spent some minutes searching for me. The breakfast was fine - yoghurt, cheese, rolls, jam, butter, tea, coffee or herbal tea, cornflakes and fruit juice. The location could not be better - only 200 metres from the Spagna Metro station, Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and the most "posh" shopping street - the Via Condotti. We really liked this place and we can't think of any important criticism. Just be sure to get a back room. We will return another year to this hotel for another holiday in wonderful Rome!

Reviews.Title: “I Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniceSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at Hotel City in Rome. It was so quaint and the staff is wonderful. They we so helpful to find us the locations, restaurants and stores we were looking for.... The rooms were clean, spacious and inviting. The staff is especially helpful. I would not think of staying any place else when in Rome... I am planning my next trip in 2009 and this is were we will stay...

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: darbyshire
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel.The rooms are spacious and clean.Hotel is convenient for shopping and sightseeing being 100m for The Spanish Steps.The Staff are friendly,which seems unusual for Rome.Always willing to advise on restaurants directions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Barry94
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Rome, this lovely hotel has very friendly staff who will help plan your itinerary. It is a small hotel but has everything you need for a short city break. Has an excellent standard of hygiene. Our room was a good size, at the front of the hotel which had some traffic noise. The room had a good size bathroom. If you want to make your own tea/coffee bring your own travel kettle. A charming continental breakfast was served each morning with the most delicious cappuccino. The hotel is just minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: labradormad
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a lovely stay at the city hotel good points- extremely helpful staff always willing to recommend restaurants and the easiest ways to see the sights. rooms very clean fantastic location right in the centre bad points- i have never stayed in such a small bedroom in all of my life! Not enough room for 2 people to move comfortably in let alone lay a suitcase on the floor! but once you get used to it it's not so much of a problem. No iron facilities at hotel so had to wear creased clothes the entire stay! no tea/coffee making facilities in room. As you can see the bad points are not major complaints and the good location and friendly staff certainly made up for these points. another word of advise- there is a bar/snack bar opposite to the left of the hotel.Be prepared for the high bar bill. 1 can of coke - 3 euros, 1 pint of local beer 7 euros!! now to me that is very extreme. We also ate in a couple of places and found the situation to be the same. was extremely surprised to be paying up to 4 euros for a can of coke?? and up to 8 for a beer and 6 for a coffee. Having spoken to a gentleman at the airport, im under the impression that this is to be expected in italian cities all over, so maybe its nothing out of the ordinary!!??!! It certainly made me feel like i was constantly being ripped off. overall you will have a great time.Rome is fantastic ( just take a lot of spending money!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erne
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel last weekend. The rooms were of a comfortable size and had a good size bathroom. Location was great just a short walk to attractions and shops. Staff were very friendly especially the Receptionist who always asked how our day was and was always happy to help out with any questions we had. I would really recommend this hotel to anyone who wished to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Ancient Rome Visits”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Excellent hospitality, clean and tidy, no fuss and centrally located just along the Via Di Macelli by the Spanish Steps. The area is alive with people and excellent restaurants of all prices. The Ice cream shop opposite is excellent and has such a wide choice of reasonably priced ices. Easy walking distances to The Colosseum, The Vatican, Castel D'Angelo (Hadrians Tomb), The Pantheon, Foro Romano, Palatine Hill Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Do the City Bus tour and get directions for the places to visit - buy your ticket (day) on the Bus or at a shop near the Bus Stop. Never felt like we were ripped off price wise except Euro 16.00 for a small beer and orange Juice in the lively Piazza Novarro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: M.Carter-Lee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the City Hotel in Rome for a 4 day break in October 2005 (via Citalia). The entrance to the hotel is situated down an 'alley'; you then have to get the narrow lift to the second floor. However, once you get there the welcome you receive from staff is warm and friendly and the hotel lobby is brightly decorated and in good nick! Out room (301) was very narrow but had two floors to it (beds on both levels) which made it into more of an appartment really (we read/relaxed downstairs and slept upstairs!). The bathroom is small and compact but clean which is the most important thing for us!. The lack of a minibar is apprarent but, to be honest, there is so much to see that you spend so little time in your room anyway. At times it can be noisy but our room faced the back of the hotel so the noise was limited. I am aware that the rooms at the front were a lot bigger than ours, but the noise from the traffic was quite loud (the same whereever you stay in Rome!). I found breakfast very pleasant - pastries, fruit and yoghurt sums it up really - I like not being 'over faced' with meats, over complicated cakes etc. like over hotels I have stayed at in Italy, so this suited me well!. You are also served freshly made coffee (you can pick the style e.g. expresso, cafe latte etc.)at your table. The location of this hotel is its strongest point - five minutes walk from the Spanish steps and 5 minutes walk from the Trevi fountain (where we eat most evenings).

Reviews.Title: “Good position in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeChatNoir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the City Hotel in September this year and found it to be more than adequate for our needs. The room was of an average size (not huge, not tiny)and clean. the only thing we would have liked would have been a mini bar or fridge, as there was no bar at this hotel to purchase drinks and no room service. The reception staff (with the exception of the guy doing the evening shift!) were lovely and really helpful, definitely one of the big plusses of this place. Breakfast was OK. Not a lot of choice but who wants to eat in their hotel when there are loads of great places in Rome to get a pastry and espresso?! The best thing about this hotel was its position. A few hundred metres from the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti, with a load of good restaurants and bars nearby. Most attractions were within walking distance, including the Colosseum (about 30 minutes walk) and the Vatican City (about 30-40 mins walk, including window shopping time!) The City Hotel was by no means luxurious, but as a base to head out and see Rome, it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very Quaint”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in September 2004. On arriving you travel up to the second floor in a quaint original lift, the reception was brightly decorated in tasteful yellow & blue with and staff very helpful, they did advise us about the obvious city noise outside and we did opt for the pleasant very clean and tastefully decorated room at the front as it was larger than the one offered at the back of the hotel, but being able to open the original wooded shutters to look out on to the street was worth it. On the down side we could have done with a trouser press. Ideal for the Spanish Steps at the bottom of the street and only approx 10 minutes walk to Trevi Fountain. We would definately stay again while in Rome a place that we must return to!
